intro: Mattiastrum sessiliflorum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Loranthaceae. It grows on various host trees, primarily in tropical and subtropical regions, and derives some of its nutrients from the host through specialized roots. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually clustered at the base of the stems. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and are clustered in small inflorescences. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains one or two seeds, which are dispersed by birds.
